Title: Preparing CIFAR Image Data for PyTorch -- Visual Studio Magazine
Description: CIFAR-10 problems analyze crude 32 x 32 color images to predict which of 10 classes the image is. Title: Collaborative programming in remote-first environment
Description: Grafana Labs is a remote-first company. We hire and work with people from all over the world. The team I am in is a 10 person team is distributed across 5 countries (you can read more about our team here. Sometimes we leverage benefits of synchronous communication and collaboration, however as an all-remote company, most of the work happens asynchronously. Recently we started experimenting with synchronous collaborative programming and I was putting together a guide for our team to use as a reference and I thought of turning it into a blog post.
